snippet: With new apartments for families tied to the military and the interior ministry, President Raúl Castro is redoubling efforts to elevate the faithful and maintain their loyalty.
abstract: Project Granma, comfortable gated apartment complex, is being built by Cuban government, and is one of several that have been set aside for most ardent defenders of Cuba's 1959 revolution; economic overhauls have rattled established order of class and status, enabling some Cubans to rise above many dutiful Communists, and Pres Raul Castro is redoubling efforts to elevate faithful and maintain their loyalty.
lead_paragraph: With new apartments for families tied to the military and the interior ministry, President Raúl Castro is redoubling efforts to elevate the faithful and maintain their loyalty.

headline.main: Cuba’s Reward for the Dutiful: Gated Housing
headline.print_headline: Cuba’s Reward for the Dutiful: Gated Housing
